metadata.name: Golden Tears #1/25
metadata.description:
Rays of light  
Emanating from the soul  
Wrap, in a moist embrace  
Debris of pain  
I cry  
Like the child I were  
Who, feeling the injustice  
Cried for a fair world  
Made by wolves  
For collarless dogs  
For trees without saws  
And happy clouds  
In which flocks of wild birds  
Who ignore borders  
Play hide and seek

Tears are golden  
They carry with them  
Sediments of souls  
Fertilising our being  
To better grow  
And teach us to see  
To feel and hear  
With our heart  
Instead of relying on  
Our blinded spirits.

I weep despite the masks  
which I wear daily  
To face the inhumanity  
Of mankind  
My sobs are my strength  
The pure golden expression  
Of my inner realm  
The rivers of my world  
The warm meanders of my thoughts  
Made visible and palpable  
And more.
